reporter_caption.center: GACKSTETTER v. MARKET STREET RY. CO., 10 Cal.App.2d 726 (1935)

caption.center: BETTY GACKSTETTER (a Minor), etc., Respondent, v. MARKET STREET RAILWAY

court.center: Court of Appeal of California, First District, Division One.

opinion.posture:
MOTION to dismiss an appeal or affirm a judgment of the Superior Court of the City and County of San Francisco. Daniel C. Deasy, Judge. Motion dismissed.
The facts are stated in the opinion of the court.
opinion.attorneys:
Abbott, Cannon, Appel Dains, Walter H. Linforth and William M. Cannon for Appellants.
Vincent W. Hallinan and William F. Herron, for Respondent.
opinion.opinion_text:
THE COURT.
[1] The appeal in the above-entitled cause having been this day decided (ante, p. 713 [52 P.2d 998]) upon the merits, the motion heretofore made to affirm the judgment or dismiss the appeal becomes moot. The motion is therefore dismissed.Page 727
